Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on imperial command
manifested and unmanifested, general and specific, four natures, three times, accomplishment
karma, fruits, realms, right and wrong, contaminated, etc., learning, etc.
body precepts, mind wisdom, general and specific, cultivation and non-cultivation
precepts class, three times, accomplishment, I wish to fully explain this chapter
If one possesses bodily expression, does one possess its non-expression?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There is one who possesses bodily expression but not its non-expression.
This refers to:
Being born in the desire realm, abiding in neither discipline nor non-discipline, currently possessing bodily expression, but not obtaining its non-expression.
Or previously possessing this expression without losing it, but not obtaining its non-expression.
There is one who possesses bodily non-expression but not its expression.
This refers to:

If a sage abides in the womb or is born in the desire realm and abides in the precepts, but does not obtain the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, and does not have bodily expression, even if one had it, it is lost;
if one is born in the form realm, one does not have bodily expression, even if one had it, it is lost;
if a sage is born in the formless realm.
There are those who have accomplished bodily expression and also this non-manifest karma.
That is to say:
if one is born in the desire realm, abides in the precepts, but does not obtain the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, and currently has bodily expression, one also obtains this non-manifest karma;
or if one previously had this expression and it is not lost, one also obtains this non-manifest karma.

If one abides in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, or abides in the precepts of non-discipline, or abides in neither precepts nor non-precepts, and currently has bodily expression, one also obtains this non-manifest karma;
or if one previously had this expression and it is not lost, one also obtains this non-manifest karma.
If one is born in the form realm, and currently has bodily expression, or if one previously had this expression and it is not lost.
There are those who have not accomplished bodily expression and also not this non-manifest karma.
That is to say:
Abiding in the egg.
If ordinary beings abide in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in neither discipline nor non-discipline, without bodily expression, even if having it, it is lost.
If ordinary beings are born in the formless realm.
If one achieves good bodily expression, does one achieve this non-expression?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There is achievement of good bodily expression but not this non-expression.
This is said:
If born in the desire realm, abiding in non-discipline and neither discipline nor non-discipline, presently having good bodily expression, but not achieving this non-expression;
Or previously having this expression but not losing it, not achieving this non-expression.
There is achievement of good bodily non-expression but not this expression.
This is said:
Holy beings abiding in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline, not attaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, without good bodily expression, even if having it, it is lost.
If born in the form realm, without good bodily expression, even if having it, it is lost.
If an arhat is born in the formless realm,
there are those who have accomplished good bodily expression and also this non-expression.
This means:
If born in the desire realm, abiding in precepts, not attaining the precepts of individual liberation, presently having good bodily expression, and also attaining this non-expression;
or if previously having this expression without loss, also attaining this non-expression.
If abiding in the precepts of individual liberation, if abiding in non-precepts and neither precepts nor non-precepts, presently having good bodily expression, and also attaining this non-expression;
or if previously having this expression without loss, also attaining this non-expression.
If born in the form realm, presently having good bodily expression, or if previously having this expression without loss.
There are those who have not accomplished good bodily expression and also not this non-expression.
This means:
Being in an egg.
If ordinary beings abide in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in non-precepts and neither precepts nor non-precepts, without good bodily expression, even if having it, it is lost.
If ordinary beings are born in the formless realm.
If one possesses unwholesome bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:ğŸ”½Those who possess unwholesome bodily non-expression also possess its expression.
There are those who possess unwholesome bodily expression but not its non-expression.
Namely:
Being born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline, neither disciplined nor undisciplined, presently possessing unwholesome bodily expression, but not obtaining its non-expression.
Or previously having this expression without losing it, but not obtaining its non-expression.
If one possesses obscured and neutral bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses obscured and neutral bodily non-expression, but there are those who possess its expression.
Namely:
Being born in the form realm, presently possessing obscured and neutral bodily expression.
If one possesses unobscured and neutral bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who obtains the non-manifest form of the unobscured-indeterminate body, but there is one who obtains its manifest form.
This refers to:
those born in the desire or form realms who currently possess the unobscured-indeterminate manifest form of the body.
If one obtains the manifest form of the body in the past, does one also obtain its non-manifest form?
The answer is:
one should make four alternatives.
There is one who obtains the manifest form of the body in the past, but not its non-manifest form.
This refers to:
those born in the desire realm, abiding in neither discipline nor non-discipline, who previously had the manifest form of the body but did not lose it, and did not obtain its non-manifest form.
There is one who obtains the non-manifest form of the body in the past, but not its manifest form.
This refers to:
the noble ones abiding in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline but not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, previously lacking the manifest form of the body, even if having it but losing it.
If born in the form realm, previously lacking the manifest form of the body, even if having it but losing it.
If the learners are born in the formless realm.
There is one who obtains the manifest form of the body in the past, as well as its non-manifest form.
This refers to:
If one is born in the desire realm and abides in the precepts, but does not obtain the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, and previously had bodily expression that was not lost, one also obtains this avijÃ±apti.

If one abides in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, or abides in the precepts of restraint, or abides in neither-restraint-nor-non-restraint, and previously had bodily expression that was not lost, one also obtains this avijÃ±apti.
If one is born in the form realm, and previously had bodily expression that was not lost.
There are those who do not possess past bodily expression, nor do they possess this avijÃ±apti.
This refers to:
Those in the egg membrane.
Those ordinary beings dwelling in the womb.
Those born in the desire realm, abiding in neither restraint nor non-restraint, who previously had no bodily expression, or even if they had, it was lost.
Arhats and ordinary beings born in the formless realm.
If one possesses past wholesome bodily expression, does one possess this avijÃ±apti?
The answer is:
One should make four statements.
There are those who possess past wholesome bodily expression, but not this avijÃ±apti.
This refers to:
If one is born in the desire realm and abides in neither discipline nor undiscipline, and previously possessed wholesome bodily expression that was not lost, one does not obtain this non-expression.
There are those who have accomplished past wholesome bodily non-expression, but not this expression.
This refers to:
Noble ones abiding in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline but not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, previously lacking wholesome bodily expression, even if possessing it but losing it.
If born in the form realm, previously lacking wholesome bodily expression, even if possessing it but losing it.
If learners are born in the formless realm.
There are those who have accomplished past wholesome bodily expression and its non-expression.

This refers to:ğŸ”½Being born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline but not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, previously possessing wholesome bodily expression that was not lost, and also obtaining this non-expression.

If abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, or abiding in neither discipline nor undiscipline, previously possessing wholesome bodily expression that was not lost, and also obtaining this non-expression.
If one is born in the form realm, one previously had wholesome bodily expression that was not lost.
There are those who do not possess past wholesome bodily expression, nor do they have this [expression] without expression.
This refers to:
Those in the egg membrane.
Those ordinary beings dwelling in the womb.
Those born in the desire realm, dwelling in neither discipline nor undiscipline, who previously had no wholesome bodily expression, or even if they had, it was lost.
Arhats and ordinary beings born in the formless realm.
If one possesses past unwholesome bodily expression, does one possess this [expression] without expression?
The answer is:
Those who possess past unwholesome bodily expression without expression possess this expression.
There are those who possess past unwholesome bodily expression but not this expression without expression.
This refers to:

Those born in the desire realm, dwelling in discipline, neither discipline nor undiscipline, who previously had unwholesome bodily expression that was not lost, but did not obtain this expression without expression.
If one possesses past obscured neutral bodily expression, does one possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses past obscured neutral bodily expression and its non-expression.
If one possesses past unobscured neutral bodily expression, does one possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses past unobscured neutral bodily expression and its non-expression.
If one possesses future bodily expression, does one possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses future bodily expression, but there are those who possess its non-expression.
Namely:
Noble ones dwelling in the womb.
If born in the desire realm and already attained a wholesome mind of the form realm.
If born in the form realm.
If noble ones are born in the formless realm.
If one possesses future wholesome bodily expression, does one possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses future wholesome bodily expression, but there are those who possess its non-expression.
Namely:
The sages dwell in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, one has already attained a wholesome mind of the form realm.
If born in the form realm.
If the sages are born in the formless realm.
If one possesses future unwholesome bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses future unwholesome bodily expression and its non-expression.
If one possesses future obscured indeterminate bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses future obscured indeterminate bodily expression and its non-expression.
If one possesses future unobscured indeterminate bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses future unobscured indeterminate bodily expression and its non-expression.
If one possesses present bodily expression, does one also possess its non-expression?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There is one who possesses present bodily expression but not its non-expression.
This refers to:

If born in the desire realm, abiding in precepts, not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, currently possessing bodily expression, not obtaining this non-expression, even if one previously had bodily expression and did not lose it, one still does not obtain this non-expression.

If abiding in neither precepts nor non-precepts, currently possessing bodily expression, not obtaining this non-expression, even if one previously had bodily expression and did not lose it, one still does not obtain this non-expression.
If born in the form realm, currently possessing bodily expression.
There are those who accomplish present bodily non-expression but not this expression.
This refers to:
Being born in the desire realm, abiding in precepts, not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, currently in concentration;
Even if not in concentration, currently without bodily expression, previously having bodily expression and not losing it, obtaining this non-expression.
If abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts or non-precepts, currently without bodily expression.
If abiding in neither precepts nor non-precepts, currently without bodily expression, previously having bodily expression and not losing it, obtaining this non-expression.
If born in the form realm, one is in concentration.
There are those who have acquired present bodily expression and also this non-manifest karma.
This refers to:

Being born in the desire realm, abiding in precepts, not abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, presently having bodily expression, acquiring this non-manifest karma, or previously having bodily expression that is not lost, acquiring this non-manifest karma.
If abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts or unwholesome conduct, presently having bodily expression.

If abiding in neither precepts nor unwholesome conduct, presently having bodily expression, acquiring this non-manifest karma, or previously having bodily expression that is not lost, acquiring this non-manifest karma.
There are those who have not acquired present bodily expression and also not this non-manifest karma.
This refers to:
Being in an egg or womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in precepts, not abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, not in concentration, presently without bodily expression;
Even if previously having bodily expression that is not lost, but not acquiring this non-manifest karma.

If one abides in neither discipline nor indiscipline, and currently has no bodily expression, even if one previously had bodily expression and did not lose it, one does not obtain this non-manifest karma.
If one is born in the form realm and is not in concentration, and currently has no bodily expression.
If one is born in the formless realm.
If one possesses present good bodily expression, does one also possess this non-manifest karma?
The answer is:
One should make four alternatives.
There is one who possesses present good bodily expression but not this non-manifest karma.
This refers to:
One born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline, not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, currently having good bodily expression, but not obtaining this non-manifest karma;
Even if one previously had good bodily expression and did not lose it, one does not obtain this non-manifest karma.
If one abides in indiscipline or neither discipline nor indiscipline, and currently has good bodily expression, but does not obtain this non-manifest karma;
Even if one previously had good bodily expression and did not lose it, one does not obtain this non-manifest karma.
If one is born in the form realm and currently has good bodily expression.
There are those who have acquired present good bodily non-manifest karma but not its manifest karma.
This refers to:
those born in the desire realm who abide in precepts but do not possess the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, and are presently in concentration;
even if not in concentration, they presently have no good bodily manifest karma, but previously had good bodily manifest karma that was not lost, and acquired this non-manifest karma.
If abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, they presently have no good bodily manifest karma.

If abiding in either immoral or neither moral nor immoral conduct, they presently have no good bodily manifest karma, but previously had good bodily manifest karma that was not lost, and acquired this non-manifest karma.
If born in the form realm, they are presently in concentration.
There are those who have acquired present good bodily manifest karma and also this non-manifest karma.
This refers to:

those born in the desire realm who abide in precepts but do not possess the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, who presently have good bodily manifest karma, and also acquire this non-manifest karma, and previously had good bodily manifest karma that was not lost, and acquire this non-manifest karma.
If abiding in the prÄtimoká¹£a precepts, they presently have good bodily manifest karma.

If one abides in non-discipline or in neither-discipline-nor-non-discipline, and currently has good bodily expression, one also obtains this non-expression. If one previously had good bodily expression that was not lost, one obtains this non-expression.
There are those who do not possess the present good bodily expression, nor this non-expression.
This refers to:
Those in the egg membrane and those abiding in the womb.
If born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline, not obtaining the prÄtimoká¹£a discipline, not in concentration, currently without good bodily expression;
Even if one previously had good bodily expression that was not lost, one does not obtain this non-expression.
If abiding in non-discipline or in neither-discipline-nor-non-discipline, currently without good bodily expression;
Even if one previously had good bodily expression that was not lost, one does not obtain this non-expression.
If born in the form realm, not in concentration, currently without good bodily expression.
If born in the formless realm.
If one possesses the present bad bodily expression, does one also possess this non-expression?
Answer:
There are four possibilities.
There is the case of one who has present non-virtuous bodily expression but not this non-expression.
This refers to
one born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline, neither disciplined nor undisciplined, with present non-virtuous bodily expression, but not obtaining this non-expression;
even if one previously had non-virtuous bodily expression that was not lost, one still does not obtain this non-expression.
There is the case of one who has present non-virtuous bodily non-expression but not this expression.
This refers to
one born in the desire realm, abiding in undiscipline, with present non-virtuous bodily expression.

If one abides in discipline or neither disciplined nor undisciplined, with present non-virtuous bodily expression, previously having non-virtuous bodily expression that was not lost, one obtains this non-expression.
There is the case of one who has present non-virtuous bodily expression and also this non-expression.
This refers to
one born in the desire realm, abiding in discipline or neither disciplined nor undisciplined, with present non-virtuous bodily expression, and also obtaining this non-expression;
If one previously had unwholesome bodily expression that was not lost, one obtains this non-manifest karma.
If one abides in non-restraint, one currently has unwholesome bodily expression.
There are those who do not possess present unwholesome bodily expression, nor this non-manifest karma.
This refers to:
Those in the egg membrane.
Those in the womb.
Those born in the desire realm, abiding in restraint, non-restraint, and neither restraint nor non-restraint, who do not currently have unwholesome bodily expression;
Even if they previously had unwholesome bodily expression that was not lost, they do not obtain this non-manifest karma.
Those born in the form and formless realms.
If one possesses present manifest karma of the class of the spiritually indeterminate that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, does one possess the non-manifest karma of this class?
The answer is:

There is no one who possesses present manifest karma of the class of the spiritually indeterminate that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, but does not possess the non-manifest karma of this class.
There are those who possess this manifest karma.
This refers to:
Those born in the form realm who currently have manifest karma of the class of the spiritually indeterminate that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.
If one possesses present manifest karma of the class of the indeterminate that is not to be abandoned, does one possess the non-manifest karma of this class?
The answer is:
There is no one who obtains present non-obscuring-indeterminate bodily non-manifest karma, but there is one who obtains this manifest karma.
That is to say:
One who is born in the desire or form realms and presently has non-obscuring-indeterminate bodily manifest karma.
Just as bodily manifest karma and non-manifest karma are extensively explained,
so too is verbal manifest karma and non-manifest karma.
If an action belongs to the desire realm, does its result also belong to the desire realm?
The answer is:
All actions belonging to the desire realm, their results are also so.
There are actions whose results belong to the desire realm, but whose actions do not.
That is to say:
By means of the form realm path,
one creates transformations belonging to the desire realm,
and utters speech belonging to the desire realm.
If an action belongs to the form realm, does its result also belong to the form realm?
The answer is:
All actions whose results belong to the form realm, their actions are also so.
There are actions belonging to the form realm whose results are not.
That is to say:
By means of the form realm path,
one creates transformations belonging to the desire realm,
and utters speech belonging to the desire realm.
And by means of the form realm path, one realizes the severance of all bonds.
If an action is bound to the formless realm, is its result also bound to the formless realm?
Answer:
All actions whose results are bound to the formless realm are also themselves bound to the formless realm.
There are actions bound to the formless realm whose results are not.
Namely:
Attaining the severing of all bonds through the path of the formless realm.
If an action is not bound, is its result also not bound?
Answer:
All actions that are not bound, their results are also not bound.
There are results that are not bound whose actions are not.
Namely:
Attaining the severing of all bonds through the path of the form realm and the formless realm.
If an action is not bound to the desire realm, is its result also not bound to the desire realm?
Answer:ğŸ”½All actions whose results are not bound to the desire realm, their actions are also not bound.
There are actions that are not bound to the desire realm whose results are not.
Namely:
Creating transformations of the desire realm and speaking the language of the desire realm through the path of the form realm.
If an action is not bound to the form realm, is its result also not bound to the form realm?
Answer:
All actions not bound to the form realm, their fruits are also like that.
There are actions whose fruits are not bound to the form realm, but those actions are not.
That is to say:
By the path of the form realm, one creates transformations of the desire realm and emits speech of the desire realm;
And by the path of the form realm, one realizes the severing of all bonds.
If an action is not bound to the formless realm, is its fruit not bound to the formless realm?
Answer:ğŸ”½All actions not bound to the formless realm, their fruits are also like that.
There are fruits of actions not bound to the formless realm, but those actions are not.
That is to say:
By the path of the formless realm, one realizes the severing of all bonds.
If an action is not unattached, is its fruit not unattached?
Answer:
All fruits of actions not unattached, those actions are also like that.
There are actions not unattached, but those fruits of actions are not.
That is to say:
By the paths of the form and formless realms, one realizes the severing of all bonds.
Are there actions that are contaminated, with contaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is.
Namely:
The outflow and retribution fruits.
Can there be a karma with both contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is.
Namely:
The disconnection fruit.
Can there be a karma with both contaminated and contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is.
Namely:
The outflow, retribution, and disconnection fruits.
Can there be a karma with both uncontaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is.
Namely:
The outflow and disconnection fruits.
Can there be a karma with both uncontaminated and contaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is not.
Can there be a karma with both uncontaminated and contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is not.
Can there be a karma with both contaminated and uncontaminated and contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is not.
Can there be a karma with both contaminated and uncontaminated and contaminated fruits?
Answer:
There is not.
Are there any actions that are contaminated and uncontaminated, and have uncontaminated fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any actions that are learner actions, and have learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
There are.
Namely:
The homogeneous cause.
Are there any actions that are learner actions, and have post-learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
There are.
Namely:
The homogeneous cause.
Are there any actions that are learner actions, and have neither-learner-nor-post-learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
There are.
Namely:
The disjunction fruit.
Are there any actions that are post-learner actions, and have post-learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
There are.
Namely:
The homogeneous cause.
Are there any actions that are post-learner actions, and have learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any actions that are post-learner actions, and have neither-learner-nor-post-learner fruits?
â€”â€” Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any actions that are neither-learner-nor-post-learner actions, and have neither-learner-nor-post-learner fruits?
Answer:
There are.
Namely:
outflow, karmic retribution, and disconnection fruits.
Are there any actions that are neither learner nor post-learner, yet are the fruit of a learner?
â€”â€” Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any actions that are neither learner nor post-learner, yet are the fruit of a post-learner?
â€”â€” Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
As the World-Honored One said:
Not cultivating the body, not cultivating precepts, not cultivating the mind, not cultivating wisdom.
How does one not cultivate the body?
Answer:
If one has not yet abandoned craving, desire, moisture, joy, and thirst towards the body.
Moreover,
the uninterrupted path that can eliminate attachment to form, one has not yet cultivated or stabilized this path.
How does one not cultivate precepts?
Answer:
If one has not yet abandoned craving towards precepts, explained in detail as in the case of the body.
How does one not cultivate the mind?
Answer:
If one has not yet abandoned craving, desire, moisture, joy, and thirst towards the mind.
Moreover,
the uninterrupted path that can eliminate attachment to the formless realm, one has not yet cultivated or stabilized this path.
How does one not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
If one has not yet abandoned craving towards wisdom, it is explained in detail as in the case of the mind.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate precepts?
Answer:
It is so.
If one does not cultivate precepts, does one not cultivate the body?
Answer:
It is so.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate the mind?
Answer:ğŸ”½Those who do not cultivate the body do not cultivate the mind.
There are those who do not cultivate the mind but do cultivate the body.
Namely:
Those who have already abandoned attachment to the form realm but have not yet abandoned attachment to the formless realm.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
Those who do not cultivate the body do not cultivate wisdom.
There are those who do not cultivate wisdom but do cultivate the body, as explained above.
If one does not cultivate precepts, does one not cultivate the mind?
Answer:ğŸ”½Those who do not cultivate precepts do not cultivate the mind.
There are those who do not cultivate the mind but do cultivate precepts, as explained above.
If one does not cultivate precepts, do they not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
Those who do not cultivate precepts do not cultivate wisdom.
There are those who do not cultivate wisdom but do not not cultivate precepts, as explained above.
If one does not cultivate mind, do they not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so.
If one does not cultivate wisdom, do they not cultivate mind?
Answer:
It is so.
As the World-Honored One said:
Cultivating the body, cultivating precepts, cultivating mind, cultivating wisdom.
What is cultivating the body?
Answer:
If one has already abandoned craving, desire, moisture, joy, and thirst towards the body.
Moreover,
the uninterrupted path that can exhaust craving for form, one has already cultivated and stabilized this path.
What is cultivating precepts?
Answer:
If one has already abandoned craving towards precepts, explained in detail as above for the body.
What is cultivating mind?
Answer:
If one has already abandoned craving, desire, moisture, joy, and thirst towards the mind.
Moreover,
The uninterrupted path that can exhaust craving for the formless realm, they have already cultivated and stabilized this path.
What is cultivated wisdom?
Answer:
If one has already become free from craving through wisdom, it is explained in detail as in the case of the mind.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate precepts?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate the body?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate the mind?
Answer:
Those who cultivate the mind also cultivate the body.
There are those who cultivate the body but not the mind.
Namely,
those who are already free from attachment to the form realm but not yet free from attachment to the formless realm.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
Those who cultivate wisdom also cultivate the body.
There are those who cultivate the body but not wisdom, as explained above.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate the mind?
Answer:
Those who cultivate the mind also cultivate precepts.
There are those who cultivate precepts but not the mind, as explained above.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
Those who cultivate wisdom also cultivate precepts.
There are those who cultivate precepts but do not cultivate wisdom, as explained above.
If one cultivates mind, does one also cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate mind?
Answer:
It is so.
If one possesses past precepts, does one also possess future and present precepts of this kind?
Answer:
There are those who possess past precepts but not future and present precepts of this kind.
This refers to:
The precepts of expression have already ceased but are not lost, and the precepts of this kind are not present.
There are those who possess future but not present [precepts].
This refers to:
The precepts of meditation and purity have already ceased but are not lost, and the precepts of this kind are not present.
There are those who possess present but not future [precepts].
This refers to:
The precepts of expression have already ceased but are not lost, and the precepts of this kind are present.
There are those who possess future and present [precepts].
This refers to:
If the dhyÄna and undefiled precepts have already ceased but have not been lost, this type of precept is present.
If one possesses future precepts of this type, does one also possess past and present precepts of this type?
Answer:
There are those who possess future precepts of this type but not past or present precepts of this type.
This refers to:
Arhats born in the formless realm.
There are those who possess future and past but not present precepts of this type.
This refers to:
If the dhyÄna and undefiled precepts have already ceased but have not been lost, this type of precept is not present.
There are those who possess future and present but not past precepts of this type.
This refers to:
When the undefiled precepts first appear.
There are those who possess future, past, and present precepts of this type.
This refers to:
If the dhyÄna and undefiled precepts have already ceased but have not been lost, this type of precept is present.
If one possesses present precepts of this type, does one also possess past and future precepts of this type?
Answer:
There are those who possess present precepts of this type but not past or future precepts of this type.
This refers to:
The initial manifestation of the precepts of form.
There is the present, and the past, but not the future.
This means:
The precepts of form have already ceased but are not lost, and this type of precept is present.
There is the future, but not the past.
This means:
The initial manifestation of the undefiled precepts.
There is the past and the future.
This means:
The precepts of meditation and the undefiled precepts have already ceased but are not lost, and this type of precept is present.
The meaning of one's own karma is accomplished in the world, and one falls into the fruition of retribution.
Knowledge, harming, retaining, abandoning, distracted mind, entanglements, Buddhist teachings.
Writing, counting, calculation, seals, poetry, worldly crafts and skills.
The accomplishment of the precepts of learners and so forth, I wish to fully explain this chapter.
What is one's own karma?
Answer:
If karma has already attained the fruition of this existence, and the fruition of karma has already arisen and is being experienced.
What is the meaning of one's own karma?
Answer:
It means attaining one's own fruit, one's own outflow, and one's own fruition.
Furthermore,
The retribution that this karma attracts ripens in one's own continuity, not in others.
It nourishes, is nourished, protects, is protected, transforms, is transformed, and benefits, is benefited in one's own continuity.
Therefore it is called one's own karma.
If karma is one's own karma, should this karma be said to be past?ğŸ”½Future?
Present?
Answer:
This karma should be said to be past.
If karma is one's own karma, is this karma accomplished?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There is karma that is one's own karma, but this karma is not accomplished.
This refers to:
Karma that has already attained present retribution, and karma whose retribution has already arisen and is being experienced, this karma has already been lost.
There is accomplished karma, but this karma is not one's own karma.
This refers to:
Karma that has not yet attained present retribution, and karma whose retribution has not yet arisen and is not being experienced, this karma has not been lost.
There are actions that are one's own actions, and these actions are also accomplished.
Namely:
Actions that have already obtained the ripening of this existence, and the ripening of actions that have already arisen and are being experienced, these actions are not lost.
There are actions that are not one's own actions, and these actions are not accomplished.
Namely:
Actions that have not yet obtained the ripening of this existence, and the ripening of actions that have not yet arisen and are not being experienced.
These actions have already been lost.
The four phrases that are not are the same as the above, and should be explained in detail.
If an action is one's own action, is this action definitely to experience the ripening?
Answer:
Four phrases should be made.
There are actions that are one's own actions, and these actions are definitely not to experience the ripening.
Namely:
Actions that have already obtained the ripening of this existence, and the ripening of actions that have already arisen and are being experienced, have already reached the final stage.
There are actions that are definitely to experience the ripening, and these actions are not one's own actions.
Namely:
If the karma has not yet attained the present retribution, and the retribution of the karma has not yet arisen and is being received, this karma retribution has not yet matured.
There is karma that is one's own karma, and this karma will definitely experience retribution.
Namely:
If the karma has already attained the present retribution, and the retribution of the karma has already arisen and is being received, it has not yet reached the final stage.
There is karma that is not one's own karma, and this karma will definitely not experience retribution.
Namely:
If the karma has not yet attained the present retribution, and the retribution of the karma has not yet arisen and is being received, this karma retribution has already matured.
The four sentences for not are also the same as the above, and should be explained in detail.
If karma is accomplished, will this karma definitely experience retribution?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There is karma that is accomplished, and this karma will definitely not experience retribution.
Namely:
If the karma is past, unwholesome, wholesome, and contaminated, and the retribution has already matured, this karma is not lost.
If the karma is future, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, but not yet obtained, and will definitely not arise.
If the karma is indeterminate or pure, it is accomplished.
There is karma that one will definitely experience retribution for, but this karma is not accomplished.
This refers to:
If the karma is past, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, but the retribution has not yet matured, this karma has already been lost.
If the karma is future, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, but has not yet been obtained, and will definitely arise.
There is karma that is accomplished, and this karma one will definitely experience retribution for.
This refers to:
If the karma is past, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, but the retribution has not yet matured, this karma has not been lost.
If the karma is future, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, and has already been obtained, and will definitely arise.
If the karma is present, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows.
There is karma that is not accomplished, and this karma one will definitely not experience retribution for.
This refers to:
If the karma is past, unwholesome or wholesome with outflows, and the retribution has already matured.
This karma has already been lost.
If the karma is future, unwholesome, wholesome, or contaminated, and not obtained, it will also definitely not arise.
If the karma is indeterminate or uncontaminated, it is not accomplished.
The four phrases of non-also are contrary to the above, and should be explained in detail.

If a stream-enterer has unwholesome karma that can lead to the ripening of suffering, but has not yet matured, when it matures, he should fall into an evil realm. What path obstructs him and prevents him from falling?
The answer is:
The two types of bonds bind sentient beings and cause them to fall into evil realms.
Namely:
The bonds of the seen and the bonds of the cultivated.

Although stream-enterers have not yet permanently severed the bonds of the cultivated, they have already permanently severed the bonds of the seen. Lacking one provision, they do not fall into evil realms;
Just as a cart with two wheels can carry a load, and a bird with two wings can fly in the sky, lacking one is not possible.
This is also like that.
As the World-Honored One said:
My noble disciples!
One should examine and record for oneself:
The pit of the dangerous evil destinies of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts has already been exhausted.
Do those who have entered the stream have the present wisdom to be able to examine and know for themselves that they have exhausted hell and so forth, and thus record it for themselves?
Answer:
They cannot.
If so, how do they know?
Answer:
Because they have faith in the Buddha's words.
That is to say:
The World-Honored One said:

If there are many learned noble disciples who are able to contemplate and see the four kinds of purity present within their own bodies, they should examine and record for themselves that the pit of the dangerous evil destinies of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts has already been exhausted.
Moreover,
those who have entered the stream have already attained the four kinds of wisdom, namely:
The wisdom of suffering, the wisdom of its origin, the wisdom of its cessation, and the wisdom of the path;
They have not yet attained the wisdom of exhaustion and the wisdom of non-arising.
Therefore, as the World-Honored One said:
Because of studying to harm, the nÄga contemplates, and after seven days, the Kosaá¸·a family will surely be destroyed.
What is it to study harm?
Answer:
There are those who have not yet separated from desire, when others harm them, they think:
May they be destroyed, may the mother lose her beloved child.
Moreover,
when those who have separated from desire are harmed, they fall back from separation from desire, thinking:
May they be destroyed, may the mother lose her beloved child. Do all those who study harm necessarily succeed?
Answer:
This is not definite.
If sentient beings create and increase greatly powerful karma, the ripening will not succeed.
How do bhiká¹£us prolong their life?
Answer:
It is said that arhats who have attained spiritual powers and mastery of the mind,
if they give robes, alms-bowls, or any of the requisites for a Å›ramaá¹‡a's life to the Saá¹…gha or to individuals, and after giving make a vow, they then enter the fourth dhyÄna to the limit.
Having arisen from concentration, he thinks in his mind and says with his mouth:
May all the karma I have accumulated that would lead to the ripening of wealth be transformed to lead to the ripening of longevity.
At that time, the karma that could lead to the ripening of wealth will then be transformed to lead to the ripening of longevity.
How do bhiká¹£us abandon the practice of longevity?
Answer:
Namely, an arhat who has attained spiritual powers and mastery of the mind, like the previous giving, gives and makes a vow, and then enters the fourth dhyÄna of the limit.
Having arisen from concentration, he thinks in his mind and says with his mouth:
May all the karma I have accumulated that would lead to the ripening of longevity be transformed to lead to the ripening of wealth.
At that time, the karma that could lead to the ripening of longevity will then be transformed to lead to the ripening of wealth.
What is mental confusion?
Answer:
It is mental confusion caused by the power of four conditions.
First, due to non-humans manifesting evil forms, one encounters them and is frightened, causing mental confusion.
Second, caused by the anger and beating of non-humans, the mind becomes disturbed due to the pain.
Third, caused by the discordance of the four great elements, the mind becomes disturbed.
Fourth, caused by the ripening of past karma, the mind becomes disturbed.
With which entanglements are the dharmas associated that are all unwholesome?
Answer:
Shamelessness and lack of conscience.
What is the Buddha's teaching?
Answer:
It is the Buddha's speech, discussion, chanting, language, voice, verbal action, and verbal expression. This is called the Buddha's teaching.
Should the Buddha's teaching be said to be wholesome?
Or indeterminate?
Answer:
Either wholesome or indeterminate.
What is wholesome?
It is said:
The speech, up to the verbal expression, produced by the Buddha's wholesome mind.
What is indeterminate?
It is said:
The speech, up to the verbal expression, produced by the Buddha's indeterminate mind.
What is the dharma called the Buddha's teaching?
Answer:
It is the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of syllables.
They are arranged in sequence, set out in sequence, and connected in sequence.
SÅ«tras, geya, vyÄkaraá¹‡a, gÄthÄ, udÄna, itivá¹›ttaka, jÄtaka, vaipulya, and adbhutadharma.
What is called Å›Ästra?
Answer:
Name-group, phrase-group, and syllable-group, arranged in sequence, set out in sequence, and connected in sequence.
What is called writing?
Answer:
Bodily action that transforms in accordance with principle, and the skillful wisdom that supports it.
What is called counting?
Answer:
Mental action that transforms in accordance with principle, and the skillful wisdom that supports it.
What is called calculation?
Answer:
Verbal action that transforms in accordance with principle, and the skillful wisdom that supports it.
What is called seal?
Answer:
Bodily action that transforms in accordance with principle, and the skillful wisdom that supports it.
What is called poetry?
Answer:
The verbal action that transforms in accordance with principles, and the skillful wisdom that supports it.
What is meant by the various worldly skills and occupations?
Answer:
It refers to the skillful wisdom that precedes and creates various skills and occupations, and the skillful wisdom that supports them.
If one possesses the precepts of a learner, does one also possess the precepts that are neither of a learner nor of one beyond training?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There are those who possess the precepts of a learner but not the precepts that are neither of a learner nor of one beyond training.
This refers to
learners who are born in the formless realm.
There are those who possess the precepts that are neither of a learner nor of one beyond training but not the precepts of a learner.
This refers to
arhats and ordinary beings who are born in the desire or form realms.
There are those who possess the precepts of a learner as well as the precepts that are neither of a learner nor of one beyond training.
This refers to
learners who are born in the desire or form realms.
There are those who do not possess the precepts of a learner, nor the precepts that are neither of a learner nor of one beyond training.
This refers to
Arhats and ordinary beings who are born in the formless realm.
If one possesses the precepts of a post-learner, does one also possess the precepts of neither a learner nor a post-learner?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There are those who possess the precepts of a post-learner but not the precepts of neither a learner nor a post-learner.
This refers to:
Arhats who are born in the formless realm.
There are those who possess the precepts of neither a learner nor a post-learner but not the precepts of a post-learner.
This refers to:
Learners and ordinary beings who are born in the desire or form realms.
There are those who possess the precepts of a post-learner and also the precepts of neither a learner nor a post-learner.
This refers to:
Arhats who are born in the desire or form realms.
There are those who do not possess the precepts of a post-learner, nor the precepts of neither a learner nor a post-learner.
This refers to:
Learners and ordinary beings who are born in the formless realm.
